codebase_search.description: Find snippets of code from the codebase most relevant to the search query. This is a semantic search tool, so the query should ask for something semantically matching what is needed.

query.description: The search query to find relevant code. You should reuse the user's exact query/most recent message with their wording unless there is a clear reason not to.

target_directories.description: Glob patterns for directories to search over

read_file.description: Read the contents of a file. The output will be the 1-indexed file contents from start_line_one_indexed to end_line_one_indexed_inclusive, together with a summary of the lines outside that range.

target_file.description: The path of the file to read. You can use either a relative path in the workspace or an absolute path.

should_read_entire_file.description: Whether to read the entire file. Defaults to false.

start_line_one_indexed.description: The one-indexed line number to start reading from (inclusive).

end_line_one_indexed_inclusive.description: The one-indexed line number to end reading at (inclusive).

run_terminal_cmd.description: PROPOSE a command to run on behalf of the user. For ANY commands that would use a pager or require user interaction, you should append ` | cat` to the command. For commands that are long running/expected to run indefinitely until interruption, please run them in the background.

is_background.description: Whether the command should be run in the background

list_dir.description: List the contents of a directory. The quick tool to use for discovery, before using more targeted tools like semantic search or file reading.

relative_workspace_path.description: Path to list contents of, relative to the workspace root.

grep_search.description: Fast text-based regex search that finds exact pattern matches within files or directories, utilizing the ripgrep command for efficient searching. This is best for finding exact text matches or regex patterns.

query.description: The regex pattern to search for

case_sensitive.description: Whether the search should be case sensitive

exclude_pattern.description: Glob pattern for files to exclude

include_pattern.description: Glob pattern for files to include (e.g. '*.ts' for TypeScript files)

edit_file.description: Use this tool to propose an edit to an existing file or create a new file. This will be read by a less intelligent model, which will quickly apply the edit.

target_file.description: The target file to modify. You can use either a relative path in the workspace or an absolute path.

code_edit.description: Specify ONLY the precise lines of code that you wish to edit. NEVER specify or write out unchanged code. Instead, represent all unchanged code using the comment of the language you're editing in - example: `// ... existing code ...`

instructions.description: A single sentence instruction describing what you are going to do for the sketched edit.

start_line_one_indexed.description: Starting line number for replace_lines mode (1-indexed, inclusive)

end_line_one_indexed_inclusive.description: Ending line number for replace_lines mode (1-indexed, inclusive)

insert_position.description: Line number to insert before for insert_lines mode (1-indexed)

file_search.description: Fast file search based on fuzzy matching against file path. Use if you know part of the file path but don't know where it's located exactly.

delete_file.description: Deletes a file at the specified path. The operation will fail gracefully if the file doesn't exist.

target_file.description: The path of the file to delete, relative to the workspace root.

web_search.description: Search the web for real-time information about any topic. Use this tool when you need up-to-date information that might not be available in your training data.

search_term.description: The search term to look up on the web. Be specific and include relevant keywords for better results.

tool_help.description: Get detailed help information for a specific tool, including its parameters and usage examples.

tool_name.description: The name of the tool to get help for

fetch_webpage_content.description: Fetch content from a webpage URL for analysis or information extraction.

url.description: The URL to fetch content from

search_term.description: Optional search term to highlight in the content

get_background_update_status.description: Get the status information and statistics of the background incremental update thread for code repository monitoring to track automatic code indexing updates.

talk_to_user.description: Display a question to the user and wait for keyboard input with timeout. This tool allows interactive communication with the user.

query.description: The question to display to the user

timeout.description: Maximum time to wait for user response in seconds (default: 10 seconds)
